embeds.title: Soul-lit Lamp
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / The Collector / Downfall

Upon pickup, gain 3 Essence. At the start of combat, add an Ember into your hand.
*A ghoulish decoration. The crackles of fire are replaced by buzzing wails.*

messages.content: It's pretty bad
it's kinda like delayed <vajra>

embeds.title: Vajra
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Start each combat with 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*An ornamental relic given to warriors displaying glory in battle.*

messages.content: also lets you pick one more collected card
3 essence is okay I guess
not very strong because collector has good strength gain inherently
ember is nice and helps prismatic torch somewhat too
and not as many ways to exploit it
it's...
okay
By act two you'll have enough essence to pick pretty much all the collected card that you'd want
it's not winning any runs though
not terrible, vajra in any form is never *bad*
but hardly on the level of other vajra-likes like pecs
<pecs>

embeds.title: Impeccable Pecs
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you gain **Strength** :p_strength:, gain an equal amount of Temporary :p_temp:_HP.
Start each combat with 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*Glorious.*

messages.content: The thing is, oftentimes there are things you want to exhaust before the embers
still can't believe this thing is uncommon
Curses, statuses, starter cards...
Itâ€™s a delayed vajra + enough essence for another collectible
Not terrible, not especially good
To be honest I'm surprised there isn't a power that just adds one ember to your hand at the start of every turn
<infinite blades> of embers

embeds.title: Infinite Blades
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

 (**Innate**.)
At the start of your turn, add a Shiv into your hand.

messages.content: I love not being able to draw collectibles because I have too many embers!
That too
There are quite a lot of ways to get embers, they're not all that valuable on their own
Hand clog hell

Really dumb idea:
Energy relic but also 1 ember every turn
<makeshift battery> already exists

embeds.title: Makeshift Battery
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

Gain :colorless_energy: and add a Slimed into your discard pile at the start of your turn.
*It's an 8.9 volt.*

messages.content: <rare collector ember skill>

embeds.title: Ember
embeds.description:
Special Skill / Colorless / Downfall

**Unplayable**.
**Retain**.
When **Exhaust**ed, gain 1 (2) **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: adding it to hand would be literal free strength so that would be too strong
<sunbloom kindling>

embeds.title: Sunbloom Kindling
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / The Collector / Downfall

**Unplayable**.
When **Exhaust**ed, gain 2 (3) **Strength** :p_strength: and add 2 Embers into your hand.

messages.content: Hand clog king
There's also <heat wave>

embeds.title: Heat Wave
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 0 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

Deal 4 (7) damage to ALL enemies.
Gain an Ember.

messages.content: heat wave is actually good though
sunbloom is often untakeable even if it is a lot of strength
also plays poorly with somber which is the king of kindling abuse
It is, and it makes this relic redundant
Getting one ember across the whole fight is such a miniscule benefit, so is getting 3 essence
Ducttaping two unrelated miniscule benertits together doesn't make for a good relic
sometimes it makes for a good relic
if those benefits are useful enough
but in this case could be a common
I'd be more happy with a relic that increses max hand size to help with hand bloat on collector
Or anything that would be in any way engaging
Not to mention that collector already has both a relic that gives you ember as well as relic that gives you essence
So getting bits of those two relics as a separate relic feels really bland

Also neither of the resources given by this relics is universally useful which is reflected in the fact that the other two relics give you choice of picking them <prismatic torch being a boss relic> and <the contract> being a shop relic

embeds.title: Prismatic Torch
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Collector / Downfall

Replaces Emerald Torch. At the start of each combat, add an Ember into your hand and gain 1 **Reserve.** Whenever you **Exhaust** an Ember, gain 1 **Reserve.**
*The ever-changing flames reflect fortune's favor.*

embeds.title: The Contract
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / The Collector / Downfall

Upon pickup, gain 10 Essence.
*Sign in blood.*

messages.content: prismatic doesnâ€™t actually give you an ember, being a starter relic upgrade
<emerald torch>

embeds.title: Emerald Torch
embeds.description:
Starter Relic / The Collector / Downfall

Start each combat with 1 **Reserve.**
*The fires of greed never fade.*

messages.content: wait lmao
must have been thinking about old versions of starter relic
right this was basically just repurposing the old starter relic and slapping some essence on it

At a baseline, strength is quite nice to have for collector. You have a good number of multi-hit attacks, and the extra frontloaded damage can help with your early game. The essence is fairly meaningless, but that has more to do with how often you will be skipping collected cards in order to keep the size of the collected deck small so that you will draw your best cards faster. Pyre is a powerful enough mechanic that you are very likely to have enough cards with it so that you can exhaust the ember by the 2nd or 3rd turn, which does awkwardly makes this a little worse than the common vajra on average. I do feel that this should probably go down to common rarity, or perhaps give 2 embers in order to account for the delayed element of the strength gain.

This relic definitely contributes, but I'm rarely happy to see it due to its rarity and delayed effect. I would only very rarely buy it from a shop (usually if I have a fiend fire or many cards that benefit from the strength). It's relatively weak when compared to similar relics, and can sometimes cause issues with hand clog if you are low on pyre cards. There will also be some relatively common situations where you would prefer to exhaust your strikes/defends/kindlings before the ember, which can create further delay on the strength gain.
this giving essence feels slapped on
it was different at one point when emerald torch still gave an ember

a free ember does fit into most collector decks, since its easy to use additional fodder, although needing something to exhaust is a problem thats very easy to solve. Embers also clash with the other "branch" cards that have exhaust synergy
when that was removed for being too slow (and making boss swap too enticing), it was moved to this relic
I still think boss swap is leads to the highest chance of winning on this character even after the immediate reserve
embers also compete with other embers. Theres a limit for how many "unplayable" cards you can have
